page.title: 04DISUSED RAILWAY at ROCESTER
page.content: In 1968 the railway was closed and is now disused. The route the railway took is still obvious, on the whole,and the ditches on either side of the track are apparent. Although the sleepers are no longer there the remains of the railway gravel are. Two station houses remain, one is inhabited, while the other is presently for sale. The track runs through farming land and is completely lost at one stage in a field of corn. The path is not very overgrown, but we saw buttercups,clover,speedwell,ladys smock,dandelions,thistles and dock leaves.We heard a cuckoo and saw wood pigeons along with Fresian milking cows. Several permanent puddles were visible, containing tadpoles which were beginning to sprout legs.
